messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Kids Chat-Wed,Oct 8?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/8/03 04:15:31 PM Central Daylight Time, nellebelle@charter.net writes: well, I was there and I know who it was.  hee, hee, hee Mary Ellen
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/8/03 04:15:31 PM Central Daylight Time,
nellebelle@... writes:
well, I was there and I know who it was. hee, hee, hee
Mary Ellen

----- Original Message -----
Erica was on too. I asked her if she was the one stealing shoes cuz it
sounds like something she'd do-lol, but she said no, it was someone else. She
asked me how old Moly is.
#####################

Matters not to me who it was, I loved that Moly had a good time! Moly only
wanted to know if the shoe stealer is a girl or a boy. I asked if it mattered,
nope I just wanna know Mom. <g> Moly is nine, she will be ten in January. She
is fired up about that. I'm gonna have a 10 party for her. 10 presents, 10
treats, 10 kids (if I can find 10 kids :/), 10 everything. She doesn't know yet,
maybe I will make it a surprise too.
~Nancy

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Kids Chat-Wed,Oct 8?
messages.msgSnippet: Holly had fun too. There were seven or eight kids when I looked. Sandra
messages.messageBody:
Holly had fun too.

There were seven or eight kids when I looked.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Kids Chat-Wed,Oct 8?
messages.msgSnippet: Erica was on too.  I asked her if she was the one stealing shoes cuz it sounds like something she d do-lol, but she said no, it was someone else.  She asked me
messages.messageBody:
Erica was on too. I asked her if she was the one stealing shoes cuz it sounds like something she'd do-lol, but she said no, it was someone else. She asked me how old Moly is.

Crystal
*****************************

Moly just got off the kids chat. She had a blast. I had to type for her the
first two times she had something to say, just so she could see how to send.
After that she was a pro. I want to thank you for setting this up. She told me
all about another child who had a yu-gi-oh (I know that isn't how it is spelled
sorry) screen name who kept saying he/she (?) was stealing everyone's shoes.
Apparently Moly found that very funny. She asked me; "Mom, why don't kids like
these live near us?" and wants to know if this is going to happen again soon.
I was busy writing some over due thank you notes and all I heard was
laughter. It really means a lot to her to get to know other unschooled kids. This was
a great idea!
~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Kids Chat-Wed,Oct 8?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/8/03 01:13:00 PM Central Daylight Time, nellebelle@charter.net writes: The kids chat is going on now.  I know Pam didn t *predict* that
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/8/03 01:13:00 PM Central Daylight Time,
nellebelle@... writes:
The kids chat is going on now. I know Pam didn't *predict* that there would
be a problem, but just before 11 am my power blinked off just long enough to
turn off the computers and make them run a scan disk. AArrggghhh!

I hope I got everyone on who present AIM screen names.

Mary Ellen
###################

Moly just got off the kids chat. She had a blast. I had to type for her the
first two times she had something to say, just so she could see how to send.
After that she was a pro. I want to thank you for setting this up. She told me
all about another child who had a yu-gi-oh (I know that isn't how it is spelled
sorry) screen name who kept saying he/she (?) was stealing everyone's shoes.
Apparently Moly found that very funny. She asked me; "Mom, why don't kids like
these live near us?" and wants to know if this is going to happen again soon.
I was busy writing some over due thank you notes and all I heard was
laughter. It really means a lot to her to get to know other unschooled kids. This was
a great idea!
~Nancy

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Kids Chat-Wed,Oct 8?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/8/03 8:01:51 AM, gailbrocop@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/8/03 8:01:51 AM, gailbrocop@... writes:

<< Hi...Is there a kid's chat today? My 10 year old son would like to
participate..does anyone know the details? We are on Eastern time. >>

From yesterday:

OK, I think I have this figured out. I just did a test with someone outside
of my home and we managed to make it work. I hope it works tomorrow!

Interested kids are invited to an AIM buddy chat Wednesday, Oct 8, 11 AM
Pacific time.

The chat will be called KidsChat

If you can't find the chat, send an AIM to melonary and I will AIM back an
invitation.

Anyone who would like to be invited at the beginning of the chat, send your
AIM screen name to nellebelle@... with KidsChat in the subject line.

If you don't have AIM, you can download it free at AOL.com

Mary Ellen

messages.subject: Kids Chat-Wed,Oct 8?

messages.messageBody:

participate..does anyone know the details? We are on Eastern time.

Thanks,

Gail
